Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BUILDUP RADIUS:This reference table identifies the magnitude of the buildup radiusfor the horizontal well. For example, the types of buildup radius can be long, mediumor short.
Column Comment.4: BUILDUP RATE DEGREE: the amount of degrees required to achieve the maximumrate of buildup, the amount of angular increase per feet/meters (measured depth).
Column Comment.5: BUILDUP RATE LENGTH: Number of feet/meters required to achieve maximumbuildup.
Column Comment.6: BUILDUP RATE LENGTH OUOM: Buildup rate length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: TOTAL HORIZONTAL DISPLACMENT: Horizontal/map distance measuring thedisplacement of the point above the terminus of a lateral hole from the surface holelocation.
Column Comment.11: HORIZONTAL DISPLACMENT OUOM: Horizontal displacement original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.12: HORIZONTAL DRILLING REASON CODE: This reference table identifies the reasonfor drilling a horizontal well. For example, some of the reasons for drilling a horizontalwell are: Water coning, Intersecting a fracture system or Incr easing productivity.
Column Comment.13: HORIZONTAL DRILLING TYPE: This reference table defines the type of horizontaldrilling. For example, Steered-bottom hole assembly or Non-steered.
Column Comment.14: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.15: LATERAL HOLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to each lateral hole. Alateral hole is that portion of a wellbore from kickoff point to TD.
Column Comment.16: LATERAL HOLE LENGTH: the length of the lateral hole which is the hole drilled fromthe kickoff point to the terminus (total measured depth minus kickoff point measureddepth).
Column Comment.17: LATERAL HOLE LENGTH OUOM: Lateral hole length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: MAXIMUM DEVIATION ANGLE: Value for the maximum angle of deviation (driftangle) recorded while drilling a horizontal hole (measured in decimal degrees).
Column Comment.19: LENGTH OF PAY: Measured length of the pay (producing formation).
Column Comment.20: LENGTH OF PAY OUOM: Length of the pay original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: RAT HOLE DEPTH: Measured depth of the rat hole (a hole drilled for Kelly operationand maintenance).
Column Comment.23: RAT HOLE DEPTH OUOM: Rat hole depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.24: RAT HOLE DEPTH TYPE: Letter indicating the source of the rat hole depth (driller orlogger)
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: RESERVOIR NAME: Code identifying the name of the producing formation.
Column Comment.27: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.28: HORIZONTAL LENGTH IN FORMATION: Measured length of the lateral hole fromthe point of entry of the targeted formation to its terminus.
Column Comment.29: HORIZONTAL LENGTH IN FORMATION OUOM: Horizontal formation lateral lengthoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
